page.title: 05Bondleigh Farm. Poultry
page.content: Poultry A few{laying hens}are kept on most farms.{Table birds}produced for Christmas/Easter. Turkeys purchased as day old poults in July/Aug. reared under heat for six weeks, fed on high protein diet with preventive medication to promote fast growth, supplemented by home grown cereals; ready for slaughter 16-24 weeks. {Slaughtering,}plucking of poultry carried out on farm. poultry killed by electric stunner, bled, dipped into hot water bath for given time and temp., then dropped into plucking machine. Spinning rubber flails tug wet feathers skin; finished by hand, air cooled on racks leave farm 24 hrs. later.{White birds}more popular than bronze; average{5-19kgs.}Approximately 3000 birds sold to butchers, wholesale and oven ready to private customers. Fresh bird market in decline.
